description: {"blocks":[{"key":"30eio","text":"This document is designed to provide the researcher with all of the information required to undertake the metabarcoding of DNA from Nematodes which have already been physically separated from soil. Here we outline our methodology for two step amplicon sequencing using the Illumina MiSeq platform.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dil3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"be6j5","text":"The aim is to provide a framework upon which the researcher may choose to add their own modifications to suit novel applications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ed538","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgai8","text":"Much of the protocol has been adapted for use from the methodology outlined in : ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ctqa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8tkd0","text":"Kozich JJ, Westcott SL, Baxter NT, Highlander SK, Schloss PD. Development of a dual-index sequencing strategy and curation pipeline for analyzing amplicon sequence data on the MiSeq Illumina sequencing platform. steps.section: Nextera index plates- Prepared prior to Step 1 PCR
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"catn8","text":"Order indexing primers direct from oligo manufacturer (For example IDT, Sigma genosys or MWG) suspended in water   scale, Desalt purification and   concentration. These indexing primers consist of: an Illumina Nextra adapter  i5 (Forward primer) AATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGATCTACAC or i7 (reverse primer) CAAGCAGAAGACGGCATACGAGAT, Unique 8bp barcode sequence and pre-adapter i5 TCGTCGGCAGCGTC (F) or i7 GTCTCGTGGGCTCGG (R). Barcode design when demultiplexed allows for the unique assignment of an individual sequence to sample.  Figure 1 gives a graphical representation of how 16 Forward, and 24 Reverse barcodes sequences are allocated to give 384, unique barcode combinations. Full barcode sequence including an additional 384 barcode combinations (named arrays A-H) is given in attached document.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":113,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":145,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"nmpgv","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"btdu0","text":"When the reagent cartridge has thawed, dry bottom with paper towel. Invert the cartridge repeatedly to check each well is thawed. This also serves to mix the reagents. Place in Fridge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"32or2","text":"Load 600 ul of the final Libary/PhiX solution into well 17 on the reagent cartridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1jn8d","text":"Unbox flow cell and PR2 bottle.Thoroughly rinse the flow cell with Milli-Q water. Carefully dry by blotting with lint free wipes (Kimwipes). Give special attention to the edges and points of intersection between the glass and plastic. Wet a new wipe with 100% alcohol and wipe the glass on both sides avoiding the rubber intake ports.Visually inspect the flow cell to ensure there are no blemishes, particles, or fibers on the glass. Follow on screen instructions to load the flow cell, reagent cartridge, and PR2 bottle. Empty and replace the waste bottle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dpegk","text":"Transfer reagent cartridge, flow cell, PR2 bottle, and flash drive with the sample sheet to the MiSeq. Open Sample Sheet from the flash drive in the MiSeq Local run manager software and queue run. Ensure the machine recognizes the correct sample sheet and the run parameters are correct.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1tbes","text":"Wait for the MiSeq to perform its pre-run checks, and press start. NOTE: If the pre-run check fails, try wiping down the flow cell again.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ds3u","text":"Ideal parameters for a 90% run:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cku6o","text":"  a. Cluster density 1000-1200k/mm2 for V2 kits 1200-1400k/mm2 for V3 kits, ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pqt4","text":"  b. \u003e85% clusters passing filter ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14p3n","text":"  c. 10% aligned (amount of PhiX) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mfgg","text":"  d. No spikes in corrected intensity plot","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4aak4","text":"  e. All indices identified following index reads ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d5l2","text":"  f. Final \u003eQ30 score of \u003e70%","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1i4ul","text":"When run complete, perform post run wash as per manufacturers recommendations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
